creator: vincent.hardy@sun.com
text:
Subject: 
               Re: FOP and Batik
         Date: 
               Mon, 30 Apr 2001 16:14:05 +0000
         From: 
               "Pier P. Fumagalli" <pier@betaversion.org>
     Reply-To: 
               batik-dev@xml.apache.org
 Organization: 
               Apache Software Foundation
           To: 
               David Theriault <dtheriau@nauticom.net>,
<webmaster@xml.apache.org>, <batik-dev@xml.apache.org>




David Theriault at dtheriau@nauticom.net wrote:

> I have been visiting the site regularly to follow the development of
> your projects - specifically FOP and Batik. I have istalled both of
> these using the Java 2 extensions directory (..jre/lib/ext/) to hold the
> jar files. If you copy all the support library for FOP, you will copy
> the w3c.jar to this area, which, it turns out, will conflict with the
> batik library. The batik library extends its own version of the w3c.jar
> code. Until I crawled around in the code to figure this out, I could't
> get batik to run. There is absolutely nothing in the batik description
> area that warns about this.
> Lest others like me curse the package as being broken, it would be good
> to add this info to the batik install page. I could't get a list of the
> batik contacts (server was down?) so I am forwarding this on to you.
> 
> Thanks in advance,
> 
> Dave Theriault

Forwarding to the Mailing List


---------------------------------------------------------------------
To unsubscribe, e-mail: batik-dev-unsubscribe@xml.apache.org
For additional commands, e-mail: batik-dev-help@xml.apache.org

creator: vincent.hardy@sun.com
text:
Added entry in the Batik FAQ to address issue:

http://xml.apache.org/batik/faqs.html.

See the last entry.
